refnamediv.refpurpose: A widget displaying a hierarchical tree

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Properties
refsect1.synopsis: "expander-style" GtkCTreeExpanderStyle : Read / Write "indent" guint : Read / Write "line-style" GtkCTreeLineStyle : Read / Write "n-columns" guint : Read / Write / Construct Only "show-stub" gboolean : Read / Write "spacing" guint : Read / Write "tree-column" guint : Read / Write / Construct Only

refsect1.title: Signals
refsect1.synopsis: "change-focus-row-expansion" : Run Last / Action "tree-collapse" : Run Last "tree-expand" : Run Last "tree-move" : Run Last "tree-select-row" : Run First "tree-unselect-row" : Run First

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The GtkCTree widget is used for showing a hierarchical tree to the user, for example a directory tree.
The tree is internally represented as a set of GtkCTreeNode structures.
The interface has much in common with the GtkCList widget: rows (nodes) can be selected by the user etc.

Positions in the tree are often indicated by two arguments, a parent and a sibling, both GtkCTreeNode pointers. If the parent is NULL, the position is at the root of the tree and if the sibling is NULL, it will be the last child of parent, otherwise it will be inserted just before the sibling.
GtkCTree has been deprecated since GTK+ 2.0 and should not be used in newly written code. Use GtkTreeView instead.

refsect2.title: GtkCTree

warning.para: GtkCTree is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.title: GTK_CTREE_ROW()

warning.para: GTK_CTREE_ROW is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Used to get the GtkCTreeRow structure corresponding to the given GtkCTreeNode.

warning.para: GTK_CTREE_NODE is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.title: GTK_CTREE_NODE_NEXT()

warning.para: GTK_CTREE_NODE_NEXT is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: FIXME

refsect2.title: GTK_CTREE_NODE_PREV()

warning.para: GTK_CTREE_NODE_PREV is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: FIXME

warning.para: GTK_CTREE_FUNC is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.title: enum GtkCTreePos

warning.para: GtkCTreePos is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para:
A value specifying the position of a new node relative to an old one.
GTK_CTREE_POS_BEFORE As a sibling, before the specified node.
GTK_CTREE_POS_AS_CHILD As a child of the specified node.
GTK_CTREE_POS_AFTER As a sibling, after the specified node.

refsect2.title: enum GtkCTreeLineStyle

warning.para: GtkCTreeLineStyle is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para:
The appearance of the lines in the tree graphics.
GTK_CTREE_LINES_NONE No lines.
GTK_CTREE_LINES_SOLID Solid lines.
GTK_CTREE_LINES_DOTTED Dotted lines.
GTK_CTREE_LINES_TABBED FIXME.

refsect2.title: enum GtkCTreeExpanderStyle

warning.para: GtkCTreeExpanderStyle is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para:
The appearance of the expander buttons, i.e. the small buttons which expand or contract parts of the tree when pressed.
GTK_CTREE_EXPANDER_NONE No expanders.
GTK_CTREE_EXPANDER_SQUARE Square expanders.
GTK_CTREE_EXPANDER_TRIANGLE Triangular expanders.
GTK_CTREE_EXPANDER_CIRCULAR Round expanders.

refsect2.title: enum GtkCTreeExpansionType

warning.para: GtkCTreeExpansionType is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para:
How to expand or collapse a part of a tree.
GTK_CTREE_EXPANSION_EXPAND Expand this node.
GTK_CTREE_EXPANSION_EXPAND_RECURSIVE Expand this node and everything below it in the hierarchy.
GTK_CTREE_EXPANSION_COLLAPSE Collapse this node.
GTK_CTREE_EXPANSION_COLLAPSE_RECURSIVE Collapse this node and everything below it in the hierarchy.
GTK_CTREE_EXPANSION_TOGGLE Toggle this node (i.e. expand if collapsed and vice versa).
GTK_CTREE_EXPANSION_TOGGLE_RECURSIVE Toggle this node and everything below it in the hierarchy.

warning.para: GtkCTreeFunc is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: A generic callback type to do something with a particular node.

listitem.simpara: The GtkCTree object.
The GtkCTreeNode in the tree.
The user data associated with the node.

refsect2.title: GtkCTreeNode

refsect2.para: This structure is opaque - you should use the macros GTK_CTREE_ROW, GTK_CTREE_NODE_NEXT etc. as well as the functions below to access it.

warning.para: GTK_TYPE_CTREE_NODE is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Create a new GtkCTree widget with the given titles for the columns.

listitem.simpara: Number of columns.
Which column has the tree graphic; 0 = leftmost.
The titles for the columns.
The GtkCTree widget.

Which columns has the tree graphic.
The new GtkCTree widget.

refsect2.title: gtk_ctree_insert_node ()
refsect2.programlisting: GtkCTreeNode * gtk_ctree_insert_node (GtkCTree *ctree, GtkCTreeNode *parent, GtkCTreeNode *sibling, gchar *text[], guint8 spacing, GdkPixmap *pixmap_closed, GdkBitmap *mask_closed, GdkPixmap *pixmap_opened, GdkBitmap *mask_opened, gboolean is_leaf, gboolean expanded);

warning.para: gtk_ctree_insert_node is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Insert a new node to the tree. The position is specified through the parent-sibling notation, as explained in the introduction above.

listitem.simpara: The GtkCTree widget.
The parent node to be.
The sibling node to be.
The texts to be shown in each column.
The extra space between the pixmap and the text.
The pixmap to be used when the node is collapsed. Can be NULL.
The mask for the above pixmap. Can be NULL.
The pixmap to be used when the children are visible. Can be NULL.
The mask for the above pixmap. Can be NULL.
Whether this node is going to be a leaf.
Whether this node should start out expanded or not.

warning.para: gtk_ctree_remove_node is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Remove the node and all nodes underneath it from the tree.

listitem.simpara: The widget.
The node to be removed.

refsect2.title: gtk_ctree_post_recursive ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_ctree_post_recursive (GtkCTree *ctree, GtkCTreeNode *node, GtkCTreeFunc func, gpointer data);

warning.para: gtk_ctree_post_recursive is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Recursively apply a function to all nodes of the tree at or below a certain node. The function is called for each node after it has been called for that node's children.

listitem.simpara: The node where to start. NULL means to start at the root.
The function to apply to each node.
A closure argument given to each invocation of the function.

refsect2.title: gtk_ctree_post_recursive_to_depth ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_ctree_post_recursive_to_depth (GtkCTree *ctree, GtkCTreeNode *node, gint depth, GtkCTreeFunc func, gpointer data);

warning.para: gtk_ctree_post_recursive_to_depth is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Recursively apply a function to nodes up to a certain depth. The function is called for each node after it has been called for that node's children.

listitem.simpara: The node where to start.
The maximum absolute depth for applying the function. If depth is negative, this function just calls gtk_ctree_post_recursive.
The function to apply to each node.
A closure argument given to each invocation of the function.

refsect2.title: gtk_ctree_pre_recursive ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_ctree_pre_recursive (GtkCTree *ctree, GtkCTreeNode *node, GtkCTreeFunc func, gpointer data);

warning.para: gtk_ctree_pre_recursive is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Recursively apply a function to all nodes of the tree at or below a certain node. The function is called for each node after it has been called for its parent.

listitem.simpara: The node where to start. NULL means to start at the root.
The function to apply to each node.
A closure argument given to each invocation of the function.

refsect2.title: gtk_ctree_pre_recursive_to_depth ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_ctree_pre_recursive_to_depth (GtkCTree *ctree, GtkCTreeNode *node, gint depth, GtkCTreeFunc func, gpointer data);

warning.para: gtk_ctree_pre_recursive_to_depth is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Recursively apply a function to nodes up to a certain depth. The function is called for each node after it has been called for that node's children.

listitem.simpara: The node where to start.
The maximum absolute depth for applying the function. If depth is negative, this function just calls gtk_ctree_post_recursive.
The function to apply to each node.
A closure argument given to each invocation of the function.

refsect2.title: gtk_ctree_is_viewable ()

warning.para: gtk_ctree_is_viewable is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: This function checks whether the given node is viewable i.e. so that all of its parent nodes are expanded. This is different from being actually visible: the node can be viewable but outside the scrolling area of the window.

listitem.simpara: Whether the node is viewable.

refsect2.title: gtk_ctree_last ()

warning.para: gtk_ctree_last is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Returns the last child of the last child of the last child... of the given node.

warning.para: gtk_ctree_find is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

listitem.simpara: The node to start searching from. May be NULL.
True if child is on some level a child (grandchild...) of the node.

warning.para: gtk_ctree_is_ancestor is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

listitem.simpara: True is node is an ancestor of child.

refsect2.title: gtk_ctree_toggle_expansion ()

warning.para: gtk_ctree_unselect_recursive is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Unselect the given node and its subnodes and emit the appropriate signal(s).

warning.para: gtk_ctree_real_select_recursive is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: The function that implements both gtk_ctree_select_recursive and gtk_ctree_unselect_recursive.

listitem.simpara: True for selecting, false for unselecting.

refsect2.title: gtk_ctree_sort_recursive ()

warning.para: gtk_ctree_sort_recursive is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Sort the descendants of a node. See GtkCList for how to set the sorting criteria etc.

warning.para: gtk_ctree_node_nth is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

listitem.simpara: The node corresponding to the row th row.

warning.para: gtk_ctree_set_show_stub is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.title: The "expander-style" property
refsect2.para: The style of the expander buttons.
Default value: GTK_CTREE_EXPANDER_NONE

refsect2.title: The "indent" property
refsect2.para: The number of pixels to indent the tree levels.
Default value: 0

refsect2.title: The "line-style" property
refsect2.para: The style of the lines in the tree graphic.
Default value: GTK_CTREE_LINES_NONE

refsect2.title: The "n-columns" property
refsect2.para: The number of columns in the tree.
Default value: 0

refsect2.title: The "show-stub" property
refsect2.para: Default value: FALSE

refsect2.title: The "spacing" property
refsect2.para: The number of pixels between the tree and the columns.
Default value: 0

refsect2.title: The "tree-column" property
refsect2.para: The column in which the actual tree graphic appears.
Default value: 0

refsect2.title: The "change-focus-row-expansion" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkCTree *ctree, GtkCTreeExpansionType expansion, gpointer user_data) : Run Last / Action
refsect2.para: The row which has the focus is either collapsed or expanded or toggled.

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal.
What is being done.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "tree-collapse" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkCTree *ctree, GtkCTreeNode *node, gpointer user_data) : Run Last
refsect2.para: Emitted when a node is collapsed.

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "tree-expand" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkCTree *ctree, GtkCTreeNode *node, gpointer user_data) : Run Last
refsect2.para: Emitted when a node is expanded.

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "tree-move" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkCTree *ctree, GtkCTreeNode *node, GtkCTreeNode *new_parent, GtkCTreeNode *new_sibling, gpointer user_data) : Run Last
refsect2.para: Emitted when a node is moved.

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal.
The node that is moved.
The new parent of the node.
The new sibling of the node.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "tree-select-row" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkCTree *ctree, GtkCTreeNode *node, gint column, gpointer user_data) : Run First
refsect2.para: Emitted when a row is selected.

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal.
The node corresponding to the selected row.
The column which was selected.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "tree-unselect-row" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkCTree *ctree, GtkCTreeNode *node, gint column, gpointer user_data) : Run First
refsect2.para: Emitted when a node is unselected.

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal.
The node corresponding to the selected row.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.
